alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Ford; Iroquois; La Salle; Lee; Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 26 at 7:25AM CST until January 26 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible due to a combination of rain, snowmelt, and heavy river ice. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois, including the following areas, De Kalb, DuPage, Eastern Will, Ford, Grundy, Iroquois, Kane, Kankakee, Kendall, La Salle, Lee, Livingston, Northern Will, Southern Cook and Southern Will and northwest Indiana, including the following areas, Benton, Jasper, Lake IN, Newton and Porter. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Poor drainage areas may become inundated. Storm drains and ditches may be clogged with snow and ice, causing localized flooding. Localized water level fluctuations may occur due to shifting river ice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Snowpack will continue to melt across the area. In addition, rainfall may add runoff due to frozen soils. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: De Kalb; Ford; Iroquois; La Salle; Lee; Livingston
